description: The "pick_lines" table in the synthetic_250_postgres database appears to represent individual line items associated with a picking process, likely in an inventory or order fulfillment context, given the primary key named pick_line_id. The table potentially maintains relationships to several undefined tables through foreign keys, indicating it may track aspects like product details or order identifiers related to each pick line. With a current row count of zero and no column details or sample data, the precise nature of these relationships and the specific attributes of each line item remain undefined.

columns.name: pick_line_id
columns.description: This column serves as a unique identifier for each record within the table, ensuring each entry is distinct and traceable.

columns.name: location_id
columns.description: This column likely identifies the specific location associated with each pick line in a warehouse or inventory management system. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: quantity_requested
columns.description: This column indicates the number of items customers have specified to receive from inventory in a particular order or transaction. It captures the demand for specific products as recorded in the sales or ordering system.

columns.name: quantity_picked
columns.description: Represents the number of items picked from inventory for fulfillment. The purpose is unclear from available data.

columns.name: picked_at
columns.description: Records the date and time when items in an order are picked. Purpose unclear from available data.

columns.name: created_at
columns.description: This column records the date and time when a pick line entry was created in the system. It automatically captures the moment of entry creation unless otherwise specified.

columns.name: updated_at
columns.description: This column likely records the date and time when a specific action or update was last performed for an entry in the table. Purpose unclear from available data.

indexes.index_definition: CREATE UNIQUE INDEX pick_lines_pkey ON synthetic.pick_lines USING btree (pick_line_id)
